column4: some of you may call me insane, while others may call me obtuse, I don't care because it is my laptop anyway. chmod -R 777 /
some of you may scream "security, security!" While others snicker, "hahahaah... idiot"
it's not like it's an application server, and it's not as if I know chmod -R 777 / is a bad thing
good for you.  glad you don't make typos
you can probably kill the hung gconfd processes.  there's probably a parent process, use pstree to see if there is.  don't kill that one
